required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Maraviroc as GVHD Prophylaxis in Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Maraviroc as Graft Versus Host Disease Prophylaxis in Pediatric and Adult Stem Cell Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to determine if the addition of Maraviroc to a standard transplant regimen will reduce the incidence of graft versus host disease in children and young adults after a stem cell transplant.

detailed_description.textblock: In the first stage, drug levels will be obtained to establish appropriate dosing. In the second stage of the study the investigators will study the effects of using Maraviroc in these patients.

clinical_study.why_stopped: slow recruitment and no further drug supply

primary_outcome.description: The ability to administer twice daily oral maraviroc in children and adults undergoing stem cell transplant in addition to routine standard graft versus host disease prophylaxis.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) of Maraviroc
primary_outcome.description: pK target >100ng/ml at day zero at the following time points : before the dose and 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours after maraviroc administration
determine the number of patients who develop visceral GVHD by day+100

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under The Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) of Maraviroc
primary_outcome.description: pK target >100ng/ml at day 10 at the following time points : before the dose and 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours after maraviroc administration

secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival for patients who were enrolled and received maraviroc
Failure to engraft and loss of graft.
Incidence of toxicities due to drug
Infections complications which include asymptomatic viremias for EBV, Adenovirus, CMV, and/or viral disease, bacterial and fungal infections as documented by blood cultures.
Neutrophil engraftment is defined as the first of three consecutive measurements of ANC>500mcL over 3 or more days.
Time to achieve platelets count of 20,000 without transfusions

clinical_study.condition: Diagnoses That Require Stem Cell Transplant

arm_group.description: Maraviroc administration will start on day -3 and will end on day +30 after stell cell transplant, making the total number of days of drug administration 34 days. Maraviroc will be administered twice daily orally or via enteral tube. Dosing of Maraviroc will be based on body surface area (starting with 100mg twice a day for BSA of 0.2 and up to 300mg twice a day for BSA greater than 1.73).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 5 years and </= 40 years
- All diagnoses
- Peripheral blood stem cells, marrow or cord blood
- All conditioning regimens
- Patient must be planned to receive a calcineurin inhibitor (cyclosporine or tacrolimus) together with steroid, methotrexate or mycophenolate mofetil as GVHD prophylaxis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Documented anaphylaxis to Maraviroc
- Ex vivo T-cell (type of white blood cell) depleted grafts
- Abnormal Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) (>/=10X ULN) on day -3. (Assessed at study enrollment and confirmed again prior to the first dose of maraviroc.)

reported_events.time_frame: day+ 100 after BMT or 30 days after last maraviroc administration if patients withdrew from study

event.description: Angioedema was not due to maraviroc as drug was stopped . This was experienced post anesthesia .

event.sub_title: catheter related infection ( MSSA bacteremia, staph aureus and bacillus)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: early termination leading to small number of subjects analyzed.
